teaser: Singer-songwriter Angel Olsen began her career as a backup singer for Bonnie Prince Billy. Since then, she’s released two albums of her own. Her latest, “Burn Your Fire for No Witness” was named “Best New Music” by Pitchfork. She mesmerized the audience at our live show with her intimate performances of “Iota,” “Lights Out,” and her […]
contentencoded:
Singer-songwriter Angel Olsen began her career as a backup singer for Bonnie Prince Billy. Since then, she’s released two albums of her own. Her latest, “Burn Your Fire for No Witness” was named “Best New Music” by Pitchfork. She mesmerized the audience at our live show with her intimate performances of “Iota,” “Lights Out,” and her cover of Richie Havens “I’m a Stranger Here.”


You can hear “Lights Out” above and listen to “Iota” and “I’m a Stranger Here” below.
title: Angel Olsen Lights up the Stage with ‘Lights Out’
